title: BACKYARD / MOTHER OF ALL WALLS
description: Stop everything and direct all attention to that wall -- it's sublime!

dialogueTree.title: Backyard Wall: "There it is -- the most beautiful o..."
dialogueTree.text: There it is -- the most beautiful of walls. Stop and admire it for a moment.

links.title: You: "Look the wall over again, carefully..."
links.text: Look the wall over again, carefully. Think about what you could paint there...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Huh?""
links.text: "Huh?"

links.title: Empathy: "He sounds tired of it all."
links.text: He sounds tired of it all.

links.title: Conceptualization: "You already have the heavy fuel oil..."
links.text: You already have the heavy fuel oil to use as paint -- it's red! -- and Cindy the SKULL has a paintbrush. This is on.

links.title: Logic: "Cindy the SKULL has all the necessa..."
links.text: Cindy the SKULL has all the necessary materials. Talk to her?

links.title: You: ""First, I know you're tired, Kim, b..."
links.text: "First, I know you're tired, Kim, but take another look at this wall. Draw *nourishment* from its beauty."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm, sure." The lieutenant looks u..."
links.text: "Mhm, sure." The lieutenant looks up at the wall reluctantly, then back at you.

links.title: You: ""I must talk to Cindy. Get the nece..."
links.text: "I must talk to Cindy. Get the necessary *materials* from her."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He sighs, then adds in a resigned t..."
links.text: He sighs, then adds in a resigned tone: "If you must."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

links.title: You: ""I'm sure I'll find the materials...."
links.text: "I'm sure I'll find the materials. Then we can come back to this magnificent wall."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose we'll have to pass by it..."
links.text: "I suppose we'll have to pass by it again at some point anyway," he says in a tone of resignation.

links.title: Backyard Wall: "The wall waits mutely."
links.text: The wall waits mutely.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Backyard Wall: "Just an ordinary wall. Nothing to s..."
dialogueTree.text: Just an ordinary wall. Nothing to see here.

links.title: You: "Why am I looking at this wall?"
links.text: Why am I looking at this wall?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Because -- you see it, finally -- t..."
links.text: Because -- you see it, finally -- this wall is *sublime*! LOOK AT IT! The shadows, the colours...

links.title: You: "(Let the conceptual joy flow into y..."
links.text: (Let the conceptual joy flow into your pupils and blossom into thoughts in your brain.)

links.title: Conceptualization: "All the other walls on all the othe..."
links.text: All the other walls on all the other houses must make a pilgrimage in adoration of this, the uncontested pinnacle of wall-craft. Colour peeled from the very face of god.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Your hands shake as they reach for..."
links.text: Your hands shake as they reach for the wall...

links.title: You: "More!"
links.text: More!

links.title: Conceptualization: "O WALLFATHER!"
links.text: O WALLFATHER!

links.title: You: ""Kim! I *must* paint this wall, add..."
links.text: "Kim! I *must* paint this wall, add even MORE beauty to it."

links.title: You: "Yes, I must paint this wall, ADD to..."
links.text: Yes, I must paint this wall, ADD to it! (Get task.)

links.title: Conceptualization: "Absolutely. Now you just need the m..."
links.text: Absolutely. Now you just need the materials.

links.title: Logic: "You already have the heavy fuel oil..."
links.text: You already have the heavy fuel oil to use as paint, and Cindy the SKULL has a paintbrush. This is completely doable.

links.title: Logic: "Cindy the SKULL has a paintbrush an..."
links.text: Cindy the SKULL has a paintbrush and paint. Talk to her.

links.title: You: "Cindy the SKULL has what I need."
links.text: Cindy the SKULL has what I need.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes, great thinking, go talk to her..."
links.text: Yes, great thinking, go talk to her. The wall will be waiting.

links.title: You: "I'm sure I'll find them. And then I..."
links.text: I'm sure I'll find them. And then I'll return to this wall.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes, do that. The wall will be wait..."
links.text: Yes, do that. The wall will be waiting.

links.title: You: "No. There is nothing to add to perf..."
links.text: No. There is nothing to add to perfection. (Back off.)

links.title: Conceptualization: "Your loss. Farewell, rain-washed wa..."
links.text: Your loss. Farewell, rain-washed wall at the end of the world.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

links.title: Conceptualization: "Your loss. Farewell, snow-flecked w..."
links.text: Your loss. Farewell, snow-flecked wall at the end of the world.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Your loss. Farewell, light-drenched..."
links.text: Your loss. Farewell, light-drenched wall at the end of the world.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Your loss. Farewell, wall at the en..."
links.text: Your loss. Farewell, wall at the end of the world, draped in shadow.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Because this is no ordinary wall. I..."
links.text: Because this is no ordinary wall. It is *sublime*! LOOK AT IT! The shadows, the colours...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yeah, why? It's a wall, an ordinary..."
links.text: Yeah, why? It's a wall, an ordinary wall.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs. "Why must we..."
links.text: The lieutenant sighs. "Why must we stop to look at this wall every time we pass by? We have business to attend to."

links.title: Conceptualization: "You have no clue. It's just a wall."
links.text: You have no clue. It's just a wall.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "Maybe this would be a good wall for..."
links.text: Maybe this would be a good wall for dodge ball?

links.title: Shivers: "So many walls all over Martinaise -..."
links.text: So many walls all over Martinaise -- weatherworn, cracked, their paint peeling...

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Backyard Wall: "This is a wall on the side of an ap..."
dialogueTree.text: This is a wall on the side of an apartment building.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Blank, conveying nothing."
links.text: Blank, conveying nothing.
